title: Home Page
text:
This project explores the climate differences between urban (Vazgen Sargsian) and somewhat rural residences of Shirak (Artik, Maralik, Panik, Azatan) in Armenia. We analyze factors such as temperature, precipitation, and air quality across various regions using data-driven methods.
    My goal is to reveal how urbanization impacts the environment and to present my findings through clear and engaging data visualizations.

title: Home Page
text:
This project explores the climate differences between urban (Vazgen Sargsian) and somewhat rural residences of Shirak (Artik, Maralik, Panik, Azatan) in Armenia. We analyze factors such as temperature, precipitation, and air quality across various regions using data-driven methods.
    My goal is to reveal how urbanization impacts the environment and to present my findings through clear and engaging data visualizations.

title: Home Page
text:
Why This Project is Important
    Understanding the climate differences between urban and rural areas in Armenia is crucial for several reasons. It helps policymakers make informed decisions about urban planning and environmental protection. Additionally, this knowledge can guide efforts to mitigate the impacts of climate change, improve air quality, and enhance the overall quality of life for residents. By shedding light on these climatic variations, our project aims to contribute to sustainable development and a healthier environment for all.

title: About
text: Hello. My name is Davit Hayrapetyan, and I have just finished Kapan’s 3rd secondary school and am going to attend AUA this fall. I have chosen Computer Science as my major. I am also interested in data science. Playing the guitar is my hobby and I am also passionate about cars.

title: About

title: About
text:
About This Website
    This website is designed to showcase my analysis of climate differences between urban and rural areas in Armenia. The main goal is to provide clear, data-driven insights into how urbanization affects the environment.
    On this site, you’ll find:
    Home Page:
An introduction to the project, a key data visualization, and an explanation of the project’s importance.
    Data Analysis Page:
Detailed analysis of the climate data, including various visualizations to illustrate key findings.
    Source Page:
Information about the data’s origin, its value, any important considerations, and a link to access the dataset.
    About Page:
Information about myself, my interests, and the purpose of this website.
    I hope this site offers valuable insights and encourages further exploration into the impact of urbanization on climate. Thank you for visiting!

title: Source
text: The data for this project comes from the TUMO Climate Net program. This initiative collects climate data through a network of sensors distributed across Armenia, providing real-time measurements on temperature, humidity, and air quality.

title: Source
text: The data for this project comes from the TUMO Climate Net program. This initiative collects climate data through a network of sensors distributed across Armenia, providing real-time measurements on temperature, humidity, and air quality.

title: Source
section: Why It’s Valuable and Good Data
text:
Why It’s Valuable and Good Data
    The TUMO Climate Net program is valuable due to its extensive network of sensors that offer high-resolution data across a range of environmental factors. This dataset is particularly useful for understanding regional climate variations because it includes both urban and rural locations, allowing for a comprehensive analysis of climate differences.

title: Source
text:
Concerns or Important Notes
    While the data provided by TUMO Climate Net is generally reliable, there are a few considerations to keep in mind:
    Data Coverage: Ensure that the data from all relevant sensors is included and up-to-date.
    Sensor Calibration: Variations in sensor calibration could affect data accuracy.
    Data Gaps: Check for any missing data points that might affect analysis.

title: Source
text:
Data Source
    You can access the TUMO Climate Net data directly from their official website.
